What issue concerns you the most?
 Is it the enviroment, the mounting national debt, poverty in the 3rd world, glbalization and outsourcing, loss of British soveriegnty to the European Union, or something else?

Well, to me, "the enviro[n]ment, the mounting national debt, poverty in the 3rd world, gl[o]balization and outsourcing" are all the same thing. Corporations pursuing short-term profits, and Free Trade that is free for the corporations and the very rich but not for the people.
 
 As to sovereignty, the states of the US are far richer than they would be if they each had their own money and their own customs services, as was the case under the Articles of Confederation before the Constitution came into effect. Too often sovereignty means sovereign irresponsibility.

Funny, i've been thinking a lot about outsourcing ever since I saw the movie Outsourced (anyone else see it yet?). I think that good or bad it's here to stay, and that we should take it as an opportunity to learn about and appreciate other cultures - rather than complain about the tradeoffs.
National debt being so large is the biggest problem with the US economy (well, really it is over spending causing a debt and the related problems associated with that).

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Econonkic issues?
